posts.post_content: Used this puppy at Pre-release. Was only able to use it once to decent effect, but it was awesome. My [Murder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Murder) spell set up Rise From the Grave by killing off [Captain of the Watch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Captain of the Watch) the turn prior. Nothing was more satisfying than bringing that guy onto the battlefield under my control, along with three 2/2 tokens.

Posted By: XMultiplicityX (7/10/2012 3:44:57 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card won me a game at pre-release I had no bussinus winning. I was @ 4 life with only 2 two disciple of neferox and a knight of infamy on the field and a safe passage in hand my opponent had a duskdale wurm and a Elderscale Wurm I knew it was gonna be over next turn cause he was still at 15 life. So he swings with everything and I triple block the Elderscale wurm and safe passage killing the wurm. On my turn I top deck this card and bring back the Elderscale which allowed me to hang on for the win! =D Great Card in my book!
posts.html:

lol, sometimes I use that line from Altered Beast just to see if anyone knows what the hell I'm talking about.

posts.post_content:
@ ThisIsSakon, I do miss the flavour text...  
  
... Especially since this one implies that it only resurrects your own creatures, not your opponents. This could be confusing to beginners (if they read flavour text more than rule text... it could happen!(?))  
  
I guess it means that you're only resurrecting the ones that you like, i.e., your ally.
